conclusion: Determine possible scenarios for particle motion based on the velocity-time graph.
The graph is symmetric about the vertical dashed line at t = t1/2.
The graph shows how velocity changes over time with positive and negative values.
At t = 0, the particle starts with a positive velocity.
Velocity decreases to zero at t = t1/2.
After t = t1/2, velocity increases and becomes positive.
In interval [0, t1/2], the particle moves from left to right.
At t = t1/2, velocity is zero and direction reverses.
In interval [t1/2, t1], the particle moves leftwards.
The particle passes through the same position three times due to symmetry.
The particle stops and reverses direction twice, corresponding to graph symmetry.
Final scenario: moves in one direction, stops, reverses, accelerates, stops again, continues in original direction.
